verses.verse: In the six <S%H8337><s%> and thirtieth <S%H7970><s%> year <S%H8141><s%> of the reign <S%H4438><s%> of Asa <S%H609><s%>, Baasha <S%H1201><s%> king <S%H4438><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> went up <S%H5927><s%> against Judah <S%H3063><s%>, and built <S%H1129><s%> Ramah <S%H7414><s%>, that <S%H1115><s%> he might not suffer <S%H5414><s%> any one to go out <S%H3318><s%> or come in <S%H935><s%> to Asa <S%H609><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%>.

Then Asa <S%H609><s%> brought out <S%H3318><s%> silver <S%H3701><s%> and gold <S%H2091><s%> out of the treasures <S%H214><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> and of the king <S%H4428><s%>'s house <S%H1004><s%>, and sent <S%H7971><s%> to Ben-hadad <S%H1130><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Syria <S%H758><s%>, that dwelt <S%H3427><s%> at Damascus <S%H1834><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>,

And Ben-hadad <S%H1130><s%> hearkened <S%H8085><s%> unto king <S%H4428><s%> Asa <S%H609><s%>, and sent <S%H7971><s%> the captains <S%H8269><s%> of his armies <S%H2428><s%> against the cities <S%H5892><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>; and they smote <S%H5221><s%> Ijon <S%H5859><s%>, and Dan <S%H1835><s%>, and Abel-maim <S%H66><s%>, and all the store <S%H4543><s%> - cities <S%H5892><s%> of Naphtali <S%H5321><s%>.

And it came to pass <S%H1201><s%>, when Baasha heard <S%H8085><s%> thereof <S%H2308><s%>, that he left off building <S%H1129><s%> Ramah <S%H7414><s%>, and let his work <S%H4399><s%> cease <S%H7673><s%>.

Then Asa <S%H609><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> all Judah <S%H3063><s%>; and they carried away <S%H5375><s%> the stones <S%H68><s%> of Ramah <S%H7414><s%>, and the timber <S%H6086><s%> thereof <S%H1201><s%>, wherewith Baasha had builded <S%H1129><s%>; and he built <S%H1129><s%> therewith Geba <S%H1387><s%> and Mizpah <S%H4709><s%>.

And at that time <S%H6256><s%> Hanani <S%H2607><s%> the seer <S%H7200><s%> came <S%H935><s%> to Asa <S%H609><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H8172><s%>, Because thou hast relied on the king <S%H4428><s%> of Syria <S%H758><s%>, and hast not relied <S%H8172><s%> on Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%>, therefore is the host <S%H2428><s%> of the king <S%H4428><s%> of Syria <S%H758><s%> escaped <S%H4422><s%> out of thy hand <S%H3027><s%>.

Were not the Ethiopians <S%H3569><s%> and the Lubim <S%H3864><s%> a huge <S%H7230><s%> host <S%H2428><s%>, with chariots <S%H7393><s%> and horsemen <S%H6571><s%> exceeding <S%H3966><s%> many <S%H7235><s%>? yet <S%H8172><s%>, because thou didst rely on Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, he delivered <S%H5414><s%> them into thy hand <S%H3027><s%>.

For the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> run to and fro <S%H7751><s%> throughout the whole earth <S%H776><s%>, to show himself strong <S%H2388><s%> in the behalf of them whose heart <S%H3824><s%> is perfect <S%H8003><s%> toward him <S%H5528><s%>. Herein thou hast done foolishly; for from henceforth <S%H6258><s%> thou shalt have <S%H3426><s%> wars <S%H4421><s%>.

Then Asa <S%H609><s%> was wroth <S%H3707><s%> with the seer <S%H7200><s%>, and put <S%H5414><s%> him in the prison <S%H4115><s%> - house <S%H1004><s%>; for he was in a rage <S%H2197><s%> with him because of this thing <S%H609><s%>. And Asa oppressed <S%H7533><s%> some of the people <S%H5971><s%> at the same time <S%H6256><s%>.

And <S%H1697><s%>, behold, the acts of Asa <S%H609><s%>, first <S%H7223><s%> and last <S%H314><s%>, lo <S%H3789><s%>, they are written in the book <S%H5612><s%> of the kings <S%H4428><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> and Israel <S%H3478><s%>.

And in the thirty <S%H7970><s%> and ninth <S%H8672><s%> year <S%H8141><s%> of his reign <S%H4438><s%> Asa <S%H609><s%> was diseased <S%H2456><s%> in his feet <S%H7272><s%>; his disease <S%H2483><s%> was exceeding <S%H4605><s%> great <S%H2483><s%>: yet in his disease he sought <S%H1875><s%> not to Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, but to the physicians <S%H7495><s%>.
And Asa <S%H609><s%> slept <S%H7901><s%> with his fathers <S%H1><s%>, and died <S%H4191><s%> in the one <S%H259><s%> and fortieth <S%H705><s%> year <S%H8141><s%> of his reign <S%H4427><s%>.

And they buried <S%H6912><s%> him in his own sepulchres <S%H6913><s%>, which he had hewn <S%H3738><s%> out for himself in the city <S%H5892><s%> of David <S%H1732><s%>, and laid <S%H7901><s%> him in the bed <S%H4904><s%> which was filled <S%H4390><s%> with sweet odors <S%H1314><s%> and divers kinds <S%H2177><s%> of spices prepared <S%H7543><s%> by the perfumers <S%H4842><s%>' art <S%H4639><s%>: and they made <S%H8313><s%> a very <S%H3966><s%> great <S%H1419><s%> burning for him <S%H8316><s%>.
